channel.title: CyberNetSec - Threat Actor
channel.description: Latest threat actor threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: VoidLink: New Modular Linux Malware Framework Discovered Targeting Cloud and Container Environments
item.description:
Security researchers at Check Point have discovered 'VoidLink,' a highly sophisticated and modular Linux malware framework. Written in the modern Zig programming language, VoidLink is purpose-built for espionage in cloud and containerized environments. It can detect if it's running in AWS, GCP, Azur...

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Cloud Security, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Russian GRU Hackers (APT28) Evolve Credential-Harvesting Tactics
item.description:
The Russian GRU-linked threat group BlueDelta, also known as APT28 or Fancy Bear, has been observed refining its credential-harvesting operations. According to research from Recorded Future, campaigns between February and September 2025 targeted energy, defense, and policy organizations in Europe an...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Phishing, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Russian Hackers Target Ukrainian Military with "PluggyApe" Malware
item.description:
A Russian-linked hacking group, Void Blizzard (also known as UAC-0190), has been targeting the Ukrainian Defense Forces with a new cyber-espionage campaign. According to CERT-UA, the attacks, which occurred between October and December 2025, use a novel malware strain called PluggyApe. The campaign ...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Poetic Justice: BreachForums Hacked, Database of 324,000 Cybercriminals Leaked
item.description:
In a significant turn of events for the cybercrime community, the user database for the notorious hacking marketplace BreachForums was leaked online on January 9, 2026. The dump contains sensitive records for 323,986 users, including usernames, email addresses, IP addresses, private messages, and Ar...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Iran's MuddyWater APT Unveils 'RustyWater' RAT in Middle East Espionage
item.description:
The Iranian state-sponsored advanced persistent threat (APT) group MuddyWater, also known as Mango Sandstorm and TA450, has been observed deploying a new, custom-built Remote Access Trojan (RAT) named 'RustyWater'. According to research from CloudSEK, this new implant, written in the Rust programmin...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Cyberattack

item.title: Chinese State Hackers 'Salt Typhoon' Breach U.S. Congressional Committee Emails
item.description:
The Chinese state-sponsored hacking group known as Salt Typhoon has reportedly compromised the email systems of staff members for several key U.S. House of Representatives committees. The cyberespionage campaign, detected in December 2025, targeted aides on influential panels including those oversee...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Policy and Compliance

item.title: FBI: North Korea's Kimsuky APT Using 'Quishing' to Bypass MFA
item.description:
The U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) has issued a formal advisory warning that the North Korean state-sponsored threat group Kimsuky (also known as APT43) is actively using malicious QR codes in spear-phishing emails. This tactic, dubbed 'quishing,' is designed to bypass traditional email ...

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Threat Actor, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: Qilin Ransomware Gang Claims Attack on Italian Manufacturer Cressi
item.description:
The prolific Russia-linked Qilin ransomware gang has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack on Cressi, a major Italian manufacturer of diving and water sports equipment. The claim was posted on the group's darknet leak site. As of January 9, 2026, the gang has not leaked any stolen data or set a p...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: NZ Patient Portal Breach Exposes Health Records of 126,000
item.description:
ManageMyHealth, New Zealand's largest online patient portal, has confirmed a significant data breach discovered on December 30, 2025. The cyberattack compromised the 'My Health Documents' module, exposing the sensitive medical records of between 108,000 and 126,000 users. A threat actor using the al...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Ransomware, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Black Cat Group Targets Notepad++ Users in Massive SEO Poisoning Campaign
item.description:
The notorious Black Cat (ALPHV) cybercrime group is behind a large-scale SEO poisoning campaign that uses malicious advertisements and manipulated search results to distribute an information-stealing backdoor. The campaign targets users searching for popular software like Notepad++. Victims are lure...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Phishing
